data.value: This function is capable of returning the condition number using one of seven different norms, depending on the value of
is defined as the norm of
times the norm of the inverse of
; the norm can be the usual L2-norm (root-of-sum-of-squares) or one of a number of other matrix norms.
The matrix whose condition number is sought.
Order of the norm used in the condition number computation:
=====  ============================ p      norm for matrices =====  ============================ None   2-norm, computed directly using the

'fro'  Frobenius norm inf    max(sum(abs(x), axis=1)) -inf   min(sum(abs(x), axis=1)) 1      max(sum(abs(x), axis=0)) -1     min(sum(abs(x), axis=0)) 2      2-norm (largest sing. value) -2     smallest singular value =====  ============================
object, and the Frobenius norm is the root-of-sum-of-squares norm.
The condition number of the matrix. May be infinite.
Compute the condition number of a matrix.
